title: STATES THAT PAY MOTHERS TO CARE FOR THEIR OWN CHILDREN
content_preview:
November 26, 2002

	 	

2002-R-0883




STATES THAT PAY MOTHERS TO CARE FOR THEIR OWN CHILDREN


 


By: Helga Niesz, Principal Analyst

You asked what states pay low-income or welfare mothers to stay home and care for their own children up to age two rather than put them in child care and go to work. You also want to know how this is possible given the constraints of the federal Temporary Assistance to Needy Families (TANF) law.

SUMMARY

Minnesota and Montana are the only two states we

title: Chapter 143B
content_preview:
Chapter 143B.
Executive Organization Act of 1973.

Article 1.

General Provisions.

Part 1.  In General.

§ 143B-1.  Short title.

This Chapter shall be known and may be cited as the "Executive Organization Act of 1973." (1973, c. 476, s. 1.)

 

§ 143B-2.  Interim applicability of the Executive Organization Act of 1973.

The Executive Organization Act of 1973 shall be applicable only to the following named departments:
